35 namespace TiledArray {
36 namespace detail {
37 
39 
51 template <typename Result, typename Left, typename Right, bool LeftConsumable,
52  bool RightConsumable>
53 class Subt {
54  public:
55  typedef Subt<Result, Left, Right, LeftConsumable, RightConsumable> Subt_;
56  typedef Left left_type;
57  typedef Right right_type;
58  typedef Result result_type;
59 
61  static constexpr bool left_is_consumable =
62  LeftConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
64  static constexpr bool right_is_consumable =
65  RightConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
66 
67  private:
68  // Permuting tile evaluation function
69  // These operations cannot consume the argument tile since this operation
70  // requires temporary storage space.
71 
72  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second,
73  const Permutation& perm) {
74  using TiledArray::subt;
75  return subt(first, second, perm);
76  }
77 
78  static result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second,
79  const Permutation& perm) {
80  using TiledArray::neg;
81  return neg(second, perm);
82  }
83 
84  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor,
85  const Permutation& perm) {
86  using TiledArray::permute;
87  return permute(first, perm);
88  }
89 
90  // Non-permuting tile evaluation functions
91  // The compiler will select the correct functions based on the
92  // consumability of the arguments.
93 
94  template <bool LC, bool RC,
95  typename std::enable_if<!(LC || RC)>::type* = nullptr>
96  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second) {
97  using TiledArray::subt;
98  return subt(first, second);
99  }
100 
101  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
102  static result_type eval(left_type& first, const right_type& second) {
103  using TiledArray::subt_to;
104  return subt_to(first, second);
105  }
106 
107  template <bool LC, bool RC,
108  typename std::enable_if<!LC && RC>::type* = nullptr>
109  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, right_type& second) {
110  using TiledArray::subt_to;
111  return subt_to(second, first, -1);
112  }
113 
114  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!RC>::type* = nullptr>
115  static result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second) {
116  using TiledArray::neg;
117  return neg(second);
118  }
119 
120  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<RC>::type* = nullptr>
121  static result_type eval(ZeroTensor, right_type& second) {
122  using TiledArray::neg_to;
123  return neg_to(second);
124  }
125 
126  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!LC>::type* = nullptr>
127  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor) {
128  TiledArray::Clone<result_type, left_type> clone;
129  return clone(first);
130  }
131 
132  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
133  static result_type eval(left_type& first, ZeroTensor) {
134  return first;
135  }
136 
137  public:
139 
149  template <typename L, typename R>
150  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right, const Permutation& perm) const {
151  return eval(std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right), perm);
152  }
153 
155 
164  template <typename L, typename R>
165  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right) const {
166  return Subt_::template eval<left_is_consumable, right_is_consumable>(
167  std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right));
168  }
169 
171 
179  template <typename R>
180  result_type consume_left(left_type& left, R&& right) const {
181  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
182  is_consumable_tile<left_type>::value &&
183  std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
184  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
185  right_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<R>::value || can_consume_left);
186  return Subt_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
187  left, std::forward<R>(right));
188  }
189 
191 
199  template <typename L>
200  result_type consume_right(L&& left, right_type& right) const {
201  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
202  is_consumable_tile<right_type>::value &&
203  std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
204  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
205  left_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<L>::value || can_consume_right);
206  return Subt_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
207  std::forward<L>(left), right);
208  }
209 
210 }; // class Subt
211 
213 
227 template <typename Result, typename Left, typename Right, typename Scalar,
228  bool LeftConsumable, bool RightConsumable>
229 class ScalSubt {
230  public:
231  typedef ScalSubt<Result, Left, Right, Scalar, LeftConsumable,
232  RightConsumable>
233  ScalSubt_;
234  typedef Left left_type;
235  typedef Right right_type;
236  typedef Scalar scalar_type;
237  typedef Result result_type;
238 
239  static constexpr bool left_is_consumable =
240  LeftConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
241  static constexpr bool right_is_consumable =
242  RightConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
243 
244  private:
245  scalar_type factor_;
246 
247  // Permuting tile evaluation function
248  // These operations cannot consume the argument tile since this operation
249  // requires temporary storage space.
250 
251  result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second,
252  const Permutation& perm) const {
253  using TiledArray::subt;
254  return subt(first, second, factor_, perm);
255  }
256 
257  result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second,
258  const Permutation& perm) const {
259  using TiledArray::scale;
260  return scale(second, -factor_, perm);
261  }
262 
263  result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor,
264  const Permutation& perm) const {
265  using TiledArray::scale;
266  return scale(first, factor_, perm);
267  }
268 
269  // Non-permuting tile evaluation functions
270  // The compiler will select the correct functions based on the
271  // consumability of the arguments.
272 
273  template <bool LC, bool RC,
274  typename std::enable_if<!(LC || RC)>::type* = nullptr>
275  result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second) const {
276  using TiledArray::subt;
277  return subt(first, second, factor_);
278  }
279 
280  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
281  result_type eval(left_type& first, const right_type& second) const {
282  using TiledArray::subt_to;
283  return subt_to(first, second, factor_);
284  }
285 
286  template <bool LC, bool RC,
287  typename std::enable_if<!LC && RC>::type* = nullptr>
288  result_type eval(const left_type& first, right_type& second) const {
289  using TiledArray::subt_to;
290  return subt_to(second, first, -factor_);
291  }
292 
293  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!RC>::type* = nullptr>
294  result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second) const {
295  using TiledArray::scale;
296  return scale(second, -factor_);
297  }
298 
299  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<RC>::type* = nullptr>
300  result_type eval(ZeroTensor, right_type& second) const {
301  using TiledArray::scale_to;
302  return scale_to(second, -factor_);
303  }
304 
305  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!LC>::type* = nullptr>
306  result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor) const {
307  using TiledArray::scale;
308  return scale(first, factor_);
309  }
310 
311  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
312  result_type eval(left_type& first, ZeroTensor) const {
313  using TiledArray::scale_to;
314  return scale_to(first, factor_);
315  }
316 
317  public:
318  // Compiler generated functions
319  ScalSubt(const ScalSubt_&) = default;
320  ScalSubt(ScalSubt_&&) = default;
321  ~ScalSubt() = default;
322  ScalSubt_& operator=(const ScalSubt_&) = default;
323  ScalSubt_& operator=(ScalSubt_&&) = default;
324 
326 
328  explicit ScalSubt(const Scalar factor) : factor_(factor) {}
329 
331 
341  template <typename L, typename R>
342  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right, const Permutation& perm) const {
343  return eval(std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right), perm);
344  }
345 
347 
356  template <typename L, typename R>
357  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right) const {
358  return ScalSubt_::template eval<left_is_consumable, right_is_consumable>(
359  std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right));
360  }
361 
363 
371  template <typename R>
372  result_type consume_left(left_type& left, R&& right) const {
373  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
374  is_consumable_tile<left_type>::value &&
375  std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
376  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
377  right_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<R>::value || can_consume_left);
378  return ScalSubt_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
379  left, std::forward<R>(right));
380  }
381 
383 
391  template <typename L>
392  result_type consume_right(L&& left, right_type& right) const {
393  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
394  is_consumable_tile<right_type>::value &&
395  std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
396  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
397  left_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<L>::value || can_consume_right);
398  return ScalSubt_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
399  std::forward<L>(left), right);
400  }
401 
402 }; // class ScalSubt
403 
404 } // namespace detail
405 } // namespace TiledArray
